definitions.definition: any or every; anything or everything
used when you are saying that it does not matter what somebody does or what happens, because the result will be the same

examples.text: Whatever decision he made I would support it.
You have our support, whatever you decide.

definitions.definition: used in questions to express surprise or lack of understanding
used as a reply to tell somebody that you do not care what happens or that you are not interested in what they are talking about

examples.text: ‘You should try a herbal remedy.’ ‘Yeah, whatever.’

definitions.definition: used to say that you do not mind what you do, have, etc. and that anything is acceptable

examples.text: ‘What would you like to do today?’ ‘Whatever.’

definitions.definition: or something of a similar type

examples.text: It's the same in any situation: in a prison, hospital or whatever.

definitions.definition: used to warn somebody not to do something under any circumstances

examples.text: Don't tell Paul, whatever you do!

definitions.definition: used to agree to somebody’s suggestion because you do not want to argue
